Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob6
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum marriott member so I know what to expect in a marriott. Not only were the rooms in this Marriott outdated, the worst was the plumbing started making noise and a bunch of sewage backed up in the tub. When I complained upon checkout, all they did was offer me some points. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel service in Indy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Butternut77
Reviews.Content: Nice people, great view, safe area with a lot of dining shopping options. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “I felt pampered!”
Reviews.Author: wtraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on a small lake and few steps away from a mall( nordstrom rack, asks fifth avenue,...) and many many restaurants including magian, bonefish grill, champs, Harry and Issy's, seasons,.. The hotel service is what it should be: very welcoming, from the front desk to the room service. Employees were always smiling and asking if if everything was Ok. I was upgraded just for asking. I ordered room service which was prompt and excellent. Later, the person who took my order called to see if everything was to my liking and it definitely was. I had the hazelnut crusted seabass and the calamari. The hotel also has a fitness area overlooking the pool and the lake. Many machines with TV monitors, fruit, and a fridge with cold water bottles were free of charge. I did not have headphones. I asked and they gave them to me with a smiling" certainly". I loved the hot cider, hot tea and coffee available at the reception but above all I give them full mark for the nice clean rooms. It was very relaxing stay and if I come back to Indianapolis, Marriott North will be definitely the one

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, incredible service, dated bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Friendaza1
Reviews.Content: The service at this Marriott is impeccable! They will upgrade you or provide lounge access...all you have to do is ask. The beds are very comfortable - on par with any upscale Marriott. The bathroom is starting to show its age and lacks granite or other personality for a semi-upscale hotel. They recently upgraded the gym to all high-end equipment...nicely done gym! This is a safe bet for a comfortable stay on the North side of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from Balcony King room...and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: theworld2see
Reviews.Content: First time to this hotel for a nice adult nite out. We requested and received a King room with a balcony that faced the lake. The room and hotel were in excelent shape and the balcony from the 5th floor had a great view. The pool and gym were nice and a plus is that the pool faced the lake and the sun shines in warming the swimming area. The staff was very friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to out of town guest in the area. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Nice area. Good business trip experience. Excellent shopping close by.”
Reviews.Author: PBACedarburg
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated lobby for the holiday season. Great service. Convenient and quality restaurant. Nice room. Good location for business visit. Excellent shopping and restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah134
Reviews.Content: Upon our very late arrival on a cold and blustery night in mid November, the clerk was most welcoming. We requested and received a room overlooking the lake since no suites were available. Note: Parking is free. Generally, we would stay at The Sheraton, but there was a couple of large conventions in town, so we opted for this location. Fatigued, we reached our room and was pleasantly surprised at the size. Spacious, clean, comfortable; the bed was fantastic. We had breakfast in the bistro (they offer buffet as well as a-la-carte). The buffet was worth the price, around $14. Great eggs benedict! Lots of college athletes were also there during our stay. Not a rowdy bunch; very respectful. We returned one evening from visiting and shopping with family and decided to have a late snack at the bar. They were very accommodating even though the kitchen was about to close. Everyone from housekeeping, to food service, to the hotel clerks and concierge were ALWAYS attentive! Will definitely recommend and stay there again. Btw, best location for shopping as this is a MAJOR mid to high end shopping area! Every store you could possibly shop is here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sh56703
Reviews.Content: I have stay here a number of times and can share these good points and areas to improve: - Really helpful great service from the front desk to housekeeping, always a pleasure - Great location with a small lake in front with walking path and walking distance to a mall - Big open room, decent internet, good TV, desk, accessories To improve - Only seem to have soft pillows - got a couple firm ones but not perfect - why are so many hotels shifting this way? - The gym is a too small and crowded - The toilet flushes like a rocket launching Overall it's a great hotel and I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: conalvo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Indianapolis North while attending a local whiskey expo. This is the second time we've stayed in this hotel, and we selected it primarily for the location. This Marriott is convenient to North Indianapolis and Carmel, right next to prime shopping areas. The hotel is large, clean, and quiet. The room and bathroom were very spacious, and we had a good view of the pond in front of the hotel. The pool was nice, but the rooms could use a little updating (especially the saggy mattresses). We treated ourselves to room service for breakfast, but the quality of the breakfast fell shy of what you would expect from a hotel like this and for the price we paid. The coffee was pretty bad, and the pancakes doughy. But the food arrived quickly and was hot. I would stay in this hotel again, especially for its proximity to the annual whisky expo, but I would forgo the breakfast and eat at one of the restaurants nearby. The service was friendly, and we enjoyed our stay. But overall, I had hoped for a little more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern Marriott”
Reviews.Author: caryon1
Reviews.Content: I love Marriott's and they are reasonably consistent but this one is brand new and top notch! Beautiful lobby and restaurant area, Marriott quality rooms, nice lounge on the 11th floor. The location is convenient to shopping and dining, as wlll as local businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pixierules
Reviews.Content: Travel for business. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. They always remember to put a fridge in my room everytime I have booked at this Marriot. Cleaning crew very nice and so is hotel staff. Will stay again anytime in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Connects to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Rocknrollchica2
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott style hotel. Nothing overly fancy but it is nice. Really comfortable beds and flat screen TV. The hotel is connected by a skyway to the convention center. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: SpaChick2
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in a nice location right beside the shopping mall and numerous restaurants. Rooms are adequate, nothing fancy, but comfortable. They seemed small to me.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Despite a Bit of Dust”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Indianapolis. My colleague recomended the Marriott as the best option in the area, close to the client site we were visiting. I was able to secure a room at the end of the hallway with a great view of the lake. Two problems with the room though: First, the bed was somewhat soft...I always have this complaint. I need a good firm bed for back problems and the only thing I can do is sleep on the side of the bed that is least likely to get the most use. The other problem was that the room hadn't been dusted too well. There were some cobwebs in the bathroom and a layer of dust on the bathroom vanity. I don't think that room was used very much. In all fairness to the Marriott, I brought this to the attention of the front desk upon check-out and they "made it right" for me, which I greatly appreciated. But I am always surprised that hotel housekeeping doesn't keep a more careful eye on such a basic issue. One suggestion: rent a car if you are staying on this side of Indy. The cab ride was $80 from the airport and there is no shuttle available at this hotel even though there is a large mall with a Nordstrom just a few blocks away. A hotel shuttle to the mall would have been a nice amenity but I guess most guests drive. Next time, I will rent a car because the Indy airport is really easy to navigate and the rental car lots are right at the airport, no rental car shuttles necessary. I did like the workout room very much. Nicely equipped and open 24/7. I didn't have to wait for a cardio machine. Yes, I will return to this Marriott if I need to come back to this area next time. The front desk team was excellent and attentive. Bell staff very friendly, too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott Hotel in the chain!! Outstanding service, amenities, Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisB_18
Reviews.Content: The Marriott North in Indianapolis, Indiana was the site for a recent business meeting that my company hosted. The services were fantastic, and the staff is beyond excellent. They anticipated our every need, and couldn't have been more helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful, has a wonderful lake for walking, and is next to some very nice upscale shopping. The food for the meeting was delicious and very well presented. I did not have occasion to eat in their restaurant, but would imagine the same quality. One evening we hosted a cocktail hour with snacks on the outdoor terrace overlooking the lake, and it was also wonderful with excellent snacks and services.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott-Not too bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that the front desk, and lobby staff are exceptionally friendly. Each staff member greets you throughout your stay. Check in process was efficient and friendly as well. Rooms are a bit dated, but spacious, clean and comfortable with Bath and Body Works toiletries. The housekeeping service is pretty basic they just changed my sheets, emptied the wastebasket and replaced used toiletries. There was no straightening at all, or effort put into tidying the room despite a generous daily tip. The wireless internet is really very bad, last night it was down completely, this happened on a previous trip as well. In general it is so slow that it is not possible to use Facetime, watch a video online or even surf the net. It was painful to even check my business email. For the television, there is no channel guide in your room or a Guide of channels or programming available on the TV. I called to ask if maybe I had missed the location of one in the room and was told someone would bring one up to me, it never arrived. There are no premium channels (HBO, Showtime, Cinemax) and a limited lineup of other channels. The concierge lounge staff was very friendly, and the selection of breakfast food is fine, scrambled eggs, oatmeal, fresh fruit and pastries etc. Basic alcohol offerings at cocktail time, I didn't have any of the appetizers or drinks. Parking is free, there is plenty of it and the hotel location is convenient to the Fashion Mall and Castleton areas.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: nrstycz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Indiapolis North multiple times over the past several years and I have always been favorably impressed. The hotel is fairly new and is a very well layed out faciltiy with nicely layed out rooms. The staff has always been friendly and professional. I had a couple special requests that were met with a can-do, anything-for-the-guest attitude. Rates have always been reasonable for a hotel of this calibre. Access is a little convoluted requiring you to pass through the Keystone at the Crossing mall and restaurant area. Another plus is the proximity to a number of good restaurants. The hotel could benefit from free internet. You might be able to draw from a nearby open wifi network.

Reviews.Title: “Nice from the outside, but not the case when you get to the room.”
Reviews.Author: bigsur221
Reviews.Content: To begin, my family and I have stayed at Marriott properties all over the country and internationally. My extended family and I recently stayed at this property. Was expecting it to be nice from the pictures and the exterior. The lobby area and swimming pool was very nice. Unfortunately the rooms haven't been updated and the inside of them looks like a hotel from the late 80's. This was concerning as we are platinum elite and were provided a room on the "concierge floor", which was exactly the same as rooms on lower floors. Don't be fooled by them telling you they are suites. Its just a long room. Until 2am there were teenagers slamming doors and keeping people up. We called down to the desk twice and nothing was done. In addition to the room issue, be aware that the very nice deck which overlooks the lake, is frequently closed off for parties and weddings. It was a beautiful weekend we were there, and we were not able to sit outside and have a drink as the entire lobby and the patio was closed off.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Marriott. Nice Exterior and Lobby. Interior of rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one weekend night and this hotel met our needs for being a place to crash after a concert downtown. From the outside and the lobby area, the hotel is beautiful and in great shape. It also overlooks a man made lake, which is nice. The area the hotel is in is one of Indy's finest and is close to a lot of shopping and restaurants. The rooms could use a little bit of updating but were spacious and clean. We were given a room at the end of the hallway (thanks Marriott!), so it was plenty quiet for us. The location isn't great if you want to get downtown. It is a thirty minute drive because there is no direct freeway access to downtown from the Keystone area. We tried taking I-465 to I-65 and Keystone all the way to I-70 and both took about 30 minutes. The farther south you go on Keystone, the shakier the area gets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriot, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Drinkwater11
Reviews.Content: Nice place, good location near shopping and food choices.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel - terrible beds!”
Reviews.Author: may2_11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility - friendly staff - a little noisy in the rooms - but the beds are terrible - linens are nice - but the mattresses need replaced!

Reviews.Title: “I AM A PLATINUM MEMBER AND HAVE ALWAYS BEEN TREATED AS SUCH!”
Reviews.Author: Butternut77
Reviews.Content: I was appalled to read the last comment regarding platinum status not being recognized at this hotel. I stay at the Indianapolis Marriott North at least 50 nights a year; it is like my second home. They treat me like family and always go above and beyond for me and all my colleagues. I travel extensively and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Indianapolis!! This is the best hotel in the state, if not the US. They are ranked the #1 Marriott in the Nation for guest service and it is obvious to me why. I am positive they recognize every platinum guest and this person was trying to get something for nothing, that's usually the case.

Reviews.Title: “Does not honor platinum guarantee”
Reviews.Author: trav_den
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this hotel for a few nights for my sisters wedding. At check in, I notified the front desk that I was a platinum member. The agent thanked me and handed me my keys. At check out, I mentioned that I had not received my platinum gift. The hotel informed me that they would not honor the Marriott guarantee! I followed up with a letter to Marriott corporate that was then sent on to the general manager 3 months later. The general managed informed me that he had talked to the front desk and they stated that someone else had checked in for me and that is why they did not have to honor the guarantee. My issues about this hotel are that they do not honor the platinum guarantee, front desk employees will lie, and they don't seem to think there is a problem having other people check into your room (even though it was not true in this case)! \ If you are a preferred member with Marriott do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “1st Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ispdet
Reviews.Content: I have just spent the last two days at this hotel attending a conference. I find it to be a superb facility. The staff is friendly and kind The food is flavorful and ample. The rooms are large and clean with a modern decor. The location is also peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: StevensbikeErkrath
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel a little outside of Indianapolis (about 30 minutes from the airport), however, nicely located in the neighborhood of a shopping mall with several high end stores. The hotel itself is a quiet hotel with good access to the highway 465. Nicely located concierge lounge on the 11th floor. Running path around a lake directly next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better based on them being "1" in 2009!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: When I arrived my room was not ready. i went to have lunch and overheard the GM and other people talking about the guests. NEXT TIME don't do it in the restaurant! When I got in my room the mattress was so saggy it was like being in my grandmother's house. I called down and they offered to send me a board. I insisted they bring up a new mattress. They did and it was much better. I did not get an upgrade. I guess I should be blessed that I was given a room. I am platinum with Marriott and do spend 300 + nights a year in hotels and do know Mr. Marriott. When I went into the concierge lounge I overheard a platinum for life customer complaining he was not able to get in the night before and had a reservation. This goes into the WHAT WERE YOU THINKING folder. They do have the concierge lounge with sodas, wine, snacks, the works. The attendant was on the phone each time I was there. I did eat twice in the restaurant and it was fairly good. I used the conference rooms and it was acceptable (A FEW GLITCHES). I did have to call to get a robe, no slippers, and no receipts for items in the gift shop? OMG. They need to work on things!~

Reviews.Title: “Very gracious & accomodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_INVisitor
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed anywhere where I felt so welcome. I appreciate the wonderful service! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marge129
Reviews.Content: I took my 4 year old daughter on a trip to Indy this past week. We arrived at the hotel an hour and a half before check-in, but it was no problem. We were in the pool within half an hour or arrival. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was GORGEOUS. We were lucky enough to have a room overlooking the lake, which had 12 turtles swimming around first thing in the morning. We ate dinner in Bistro 33 (the hotel restaurant). It was absolutely delicious and very quiet.... there was only 1 other table dining (which was good cause my daughter was NOT being on her best behavior). We ordered room service for breakfast, which was pricey but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience - First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Bellburgmaggie
Reviews.Content: After traveling across two states and working a half day, the staff at the Marriott made check in seamless. They were friendly, kind and helpful. I got up to my room and realized I left all of my toiletries at home. I was EXHAUSTED. I came down to find out the nearest Walgreens/drug store and they promptly printed the map for me. Then the staff said "We can make you a little toiletry package that includes a tooth brush, deodarant, tooth paste, etc. " I was SO TIRED and SO EXCITED that I would not have to go out that night that I accepted. When I came down the next day, they actually asked if the "goodies" were to my satisfactionl. YES! Additionally, our group was so tired from the drive that our group ate in the hotel restaurant. The food was good. The wine the server suggested was GREAT! Its a shame the place was empty because we all thought it was a good value for a hotel. Then the next week I needed to stay in Indy, but every other hotesl couldn't be bothered. This Marriot could not have been nicer in helping me and my family a room. Book this hotel with confidence. The rooms are clean, the staff is nice, the food (at dinner) was good. It may not be the cheapest room in town, but its a good value for those who want quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Johnny2032
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel-Keystone Mall is within walking distance and Castleton Mall is about 3 minutes away. About any restaraunt you could imagine is within10 minutes away (Champ's, Maggiano's, PF Changs, Friday's, and Cheesecake Factory are right by the hotel) and there are a ton of places to eat near Castleton. The lobby was nice and spacious and the rooms were clean and comfortable (bathrooms were pretty big). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: accountant_guy
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Marriott guest choosing to stay at their hotels whenever possible. The service at this full service Marriott is right up there with some of the best I have seen. The price and location were also great. I had breakfast included for myself, wife, and children for about 13 bucks. The breakfast was buffet style, and everything was excellent. The only thing that prevented me from giving this hotel five circles is the room decor was a bit dated and the Internet was wired as opposed to my preferred wireless. These two items however would definitely not prevent me from staying here again or recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in hot, humid July”
Reviews.Author: Sussex9
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Marriott North in July could not have been better! It was very hot, but the hotel was cool and comfortable. The staff at reception and in the restaurant were very welcoming and really tried to make my stay as pleasant as possible. The room was very spacious, clean, nicely decorated and the bed with lots of big, soft pillows was heaven! I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it for business and for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...newer, and worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel. It is on the waterfront of a small lake or large pond. The building is newer. The rooms are new. The food is good. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, WONDERFULLY PRICED!!”
Reviews.Author: winkyjrp
Reviews.Content: Myself, my spouse, and 2 children stayed here just for 1 night for a church function. I love Marriott properties as I always find them enjoyable. I have actually stayed at the Marriott East in Indy before, and found that this property was closer to where we needed to be this time. We paid about 109.00 online booked straight thru the Marriott(no priceline,etc) and was happy with the price,but didn't expect as much as we received. I'd read the reviews and saw that the hotel rated #10 of hotels in Indy, and thought that was great. I was pleasantly surprised when we pulled up to the hotel and saw what looked like a plush expensive property. This hotel is GORGEOUS!!!!!! The lobby is large and spacious. When I got to the front desk at 3:45 Indy time,(check in 4:00) the clerk told us our room was not quite ready. After waiting for about 25 mins no one said anything to us yet. My husband went back to check on the room and the clerk gave us another room which was better than the one we were supposed to have. It boasted a beautiful balcony that we enjoyed sitting on and looking at the ducks swimming in the nearby lake/pond. We had a king size bed and my son had a air mattress. All of our accomodations were clean and very comfortable. (I wanted to take the bed home) The room was spotless. The desk clerk called up to check on our room. Wonderful service!!! This hotel is located near many shopping places and restaurants- our favorite being The Cheesecake Factory directly next to Sax Fifth Avenue. The TV was another plus, a FLAT SCREEN HD TV!!! We don't have HD at home so that was definitely a treat. I did need to use the business center to print out menus for the nearby restaurants. The business center is amazing. It was about 4 HP Slimline Computers with Flat Screen Monitors, Laser Printers, Fax Machines, the works!!! Check out was a breeze as well. I would stay here again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: wonderin_y
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. We were greeted nicely at the counter and given a quick check-in. I had trouble with the TV where I had audio but no video. I called the front desk and they told me to shut off the tv for 20 seconds and turn back on with the remote. Seemed odd but it worked. I had another problem with the TV and I called the front desk again. I explained the problem and they sent a service person up and he was there in about 1 minute and fixed the problem. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Our room overlooked the parking lot on the 5th floor so there wasn't much to talk about there but we were only spending one night and the view wasn't important but if you're staying a while I would ask for a room on the side that faces the lake. Room service was very prompt even though the girl at the front counter told us it would be up to two hours to get our meal due to how busy it was which seemed a bit strange to me. We had our meal within 20 minutes. Food was above average from the Bistro. We ate breakfast in the Bistro but had bad service from the waiter. It was maybe 10 minutes before we saw anything of him when we were seated and then another 10-15 minutes to come back with drinks. We ended up going up to the Buffet due to his lack of attention figuring it would be quicker service. They had a good selection of food which was pretty tasty. Again, the waiter was no where to be found for refills of our drinks. When asked for more coffee, he forgot but eventually showed up with our bill. Overall, a nice stay, clean room, comfortable bed and the hotel staff very polite and attentive with the exception of the Bistro waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Great lake view”
Reviews.Author: Chiefette1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night near the end of December 2008. The hotel overall is lovely. Ask for a lake view and a high floor. There was a large balcony outside of our room (some outside chairs would have been a nice touch, but there weren't any). Has a beautiful lobby with a covered entry/driveway. The staff was very pleasant and the BBQ quesadillas from room service were fantastic. This hotel is next to a suburban type mall with higher end retail. There are a few restaurants nearby. We did not see any fast food places close to the hotel. There is a large chain bookstore across the lake. We felt safe in the area and it is easy to get on and off the highway near the hotel. There were some small issues with our room - primarily hair on the bathroom floor and shower walls. However, the room was completely clean otherwise. I found the room we were in to be quieter than average as to hallway noise. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Where are the amenities?”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: As we drove up to the Marriott in Indy, we noticed that there was plenty of self parking spaces available so we did not do valet, which is probably a good thing, because there wasn’t anyone except the girl behind the desk present. Oh well. Check in was fine, but some things were noticeably missing. How about a Starbucks? That would have been nice after a 5 hour drive, but they did have lemonade. Oh and they did offer coffee in a press pot, and a bar! A bar? I would have rather had a Starbucks! I would have taken a glass of lemonade with me to my room, but unfortunately I had to wheel my luggage—no free hands. No bellman either. We were lucky enough to get a room several floors up with a view of a small pond and a distant view of the city. We had a nice sized balcony but alas--no chairs! I was happy to see an iron and ironing board, a coffee maker (however, very cheap food service grade coffee) and a bath robe and a flat screen TV. The large bed was nice and comfy with nice linens. It’s too bad they opted out for the luxury towels in the bathroom—they were horribly scratchy! Also, there wasn’t a make-up mirror, a mini bar or a safe in the room. Hummmm, makes one wonder, with an upscale mall across the street, don’t you think that a female guest might visit the hotel and want some of these essential amenities? It’s not all men who travel nowadays! To be fair, it is a nice hotel, they just forgot to cater to an upscale clientele. Maybe the Hyatt next time???

Reviews.Title: “Live Here & Still Felt Like Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LSMac
Reviews.Content: My mom and I had a mother/daughter weekend and we truly felt we were on vacation! We had a king room with a very large balcony looking over the lake at the back of the property. The room was extremely comfortable and large. The view from the balcony was superb. The only downfall, no table or chairs on the patio to enable one to sit out and enjoy the view. Also, there is an outside restaurant/bar on the opposite side of the lake. It's nice to hear the live music, but not when you are trying to sleep at midnight. Bring your earplugs. We treated ourselves to room service and dessert. The banana split and the raspberry sorbet were AWESOME and our service person, Matt, was so polite and helpful. We went to the Bistro for breakfast and truly enjoyed the buffet and again the beautiful view of the lake. Even though we live on the northside of Indianapolis, we would most definitely stay at the Marriott again. I am planning a weekend retreat for me and my husband. We will get a great weekend and save on gas.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: QueenRat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room - Large, great view, flat screen tv, feather pillow top on bed. Pleasant staff. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay on Indy's North Side”
Reviews.Author: Delmarvin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this Marriott three times over the past eight months. It's a most pleasant hotel and our first choice when staying in Indy. Rooms are spacious, modern, very clean, have comfortable beds and are quiet. Staff is exceedingly friendly and efficient. Rooms on the hotel's south side have the best view, overlooking the small lake and surrounding area. The breakfast buffet in the Bistro 33 restaurant is excellent. All in all, highly recommended when traveling to Indy's north side. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: needhelp2315
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for me. I came into Indianapolis with my children and mother, and we all enjoyed our stay at this Marriott. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, the restaurant (Bistro) was tasty and the view of the lake was pleasing to the eyes and relaxing to the mind. If I had to find something negative to say about this hotel, it would be that it's distance to downtown Indianapolis was about 20 minutes away. Anytime I travel to this area, I plan on staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Theaxman
Reviews.Content: Will stay here in a heartbeat. Tremendously surprising for a midwest hotel. Everything about the hotel was first-class. Service, food, location, view, rooms, pool, exercise room. I could live in this hotel. Not the Ritz, but very well run.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: pvtsms
Reviews.Content: We checked in (husband, 13 yr. old, 10 yr. old, myself) around 9:30 pm on Friday and stayed through Monday. The rooms are immaculate and the beds are very comfy. The room service food is really good - we were all quite surprised at how yummy it was. The pool is a larger one than we expected - normally indoor pools in the mid range price are small - this one had plenty of room and there was a hot tub as well. The workout room did leave something to be desired however. There were plenty of treadmills, 2 bikes and only 1 elliptical. They did have free weights and 2 benches - not the best area, but not the worst either. The staff was always friendly and very helpful! No problems whatsoever. Overall, the experience was terrific - loved being right in the middle of Keystone at the Crossing - a great shopping area with plenty of restaurants to choose from. You won't go wrong by staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: ranjbills
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent several weekend get-a-ways at this Marriott. Staff has always been very cordial and the rooms very clean. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have slept on, with any hotel chain. Close to several restaurants and shopping at Keystone. We recommend this hotel and will be staying again in the next month or two.

Reviews.Title: “A very well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: markmdb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Marriott North several times on business, and never wrote a review. But having stayed at six other Marriotts in the past three months, I can say this one really is top-notch. It's a pretty hotel in a good location. And sure it helped they upgraded my room. But what really makes the difference here is the service. Every staff member goes the extra mile to make things easier and friendlier -- at check in/out, at the front door, in the bar, etc. They really do a great job cultivating a culture of service, friendliess and respect among the staff. Add to it that it's a very attractive hotel -- and you've got a great, great Marriott. Yes -- it's getting time to upgrade the TVs in the rooms, but other than that, you can't get more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful weekend at the Indianapolis Marriott North. Our daughter just graduated from Butler University. We discovered this great hotel 4 years ago when she just started school there. We tried other hotels in the downtown area during her Freshman year at college, but my husband would agree with me.... this hotel is by far THE BEST! The staff is so friendly, the beds are soooo comfortable and the view of the the small pond is so refreshing to look at in the morning and evening. We always looked forward to staying there when we did our parents visits at Butler. I know we will stay there again when passing thru Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: popup
Reviews.Content: Just return from Indianapolis; stayed at the Marriott North. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice. We were upgraded to a Jr Exec Suite. Had dinner at the restaurant and food was very good. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dstravel
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Marriott North and thought it was a great hotel! We stayed in a King non smoking. The room was quite large, bed was wonderful, soft, down comforters, bathroom was large. Overall, the hotel was very clean, front desk friendly. (We did not see the pool area). Breakfast was included in our stay and the food was great! Made to order omelets, lots of fresh fruit and many other items on the buffett. The only problem we had at the hotel was that we had to wait almost two hours for our room. They had a large party check out at 4:00 pm so there were no rooms available when we arrived to check in at 3:30 (or for a lot of other guests). Besides that, everything was fine. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in a great area.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property. It looks to be only a couple years old. The building has a very good design. We recently attended the NCAA tournament and choose this hotel. We choose wisely. It is in a great area. Surrounded by the best shopping and dinning in indy. The best thing, very reasonable rates. We saw the Marriott downtown, It looks great but, the price is no bargain. The Marriott east was happened apon on our way to the Marriott north. It seemed a little old and unlike most Marriott properties. The Marriott North is going to be our Indy hotel solution from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryMooreRIP
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the North Indy Marriott in Feb 05 and was really impressed. The hotel is very comfortable and the superior rooms on the 10th floor are luxurious - probably the softest and most relaxing hotel bed I've ever slept in! The rooms are great if you're there on business - good-sized desk, lots of complimentary office facilities, and email/web access via the hotel's server for only $9.95 a day was good value. What really made this hotel outstanding for me was the attention to detail and genuinely positive attitude of the staff - for instance, 15 mins after my room service breakfast arrived, the restaurant manager rang me to ask if it was OK and if I'd gotten everything I wanted. This, and many other examples of very good customer service, weren't in any way artificial - the staff really wanted to do the best possible job. I'll certainly be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arcunnin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Newer Marriott. Clean. Soft beds. Nice pool/spa area. Great location next to upscale mall and plenty of restaraunts.

Reviews.Title: “very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott North on two different occasions. It is a nice, well-kept, typical Marriott. The rooms are average hotel rooms, nothing special, but comfortable. One thing that did stand out was the attentiveness of the staff. They are very friendly and constantly checking on you to make sure everything is okay. If anything is wrong, they will remedy it immediately. Service like that is lacking too many places these days.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Average”
Reviews.Author: IslandRob
Reviews.Content: This is your basic Marriott. Stayed here for three nights in Feb. '04. The rooms are clean, but offer nothing special. Overall, the food was good, but nothing was great. Hotel staff was very nice. Shopping and several good restaurants within walking distance. No complaints.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Indianapolis North
HotelInfo.Address: 3645 River Crossing Pkwy, Indianapolis, IN 46240
